DataElement.preferredDefinition: The anatomical site where radiotherapy has occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the anatomic location of radiation therapy

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to anatomy.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: Relating to anatomy.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the anatomic site at which an exam is performed using a medical imaging device.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition with most recent NCIt version. mc 2/15/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: That portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: CARDIAC

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Definition not available.

Concepts.definition: Definition not available.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Paired glands situated in the retroperitoneal tissues at the superior pole of each kidney.

Concepts.definition: A flattened, roughly triangular body resting upon the upper end of each kidney; it is one of the ductless glands furnishing internal secretions (epinephrine and norepinephrine from the medulla and steroid hormones from the cortex).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.

Concepts.definition: The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (SER-viks) The lower, narrow end of the uterus that forms a canal between the uterus and vagina.

Concepts.definition: The lower part of the uterus occupying the region between the isthmus of the uterus and the vagina. It is divided into supravaginal and vaginal portions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: HEAD AND NECK

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

Concepts.definition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova; surrounding this stroma is a more condensed layer of stroma called the tunica albuginea.

Concepts.definition: One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (PLOOR-a) A thin layer of tissue covering the lungs and the wall of the chest cavity to protect and cushion the lungs. A small amount of fluid that acts as a lubricant allows the lungs to move smoothly in the chest cavity during breathing.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (PAIR-ih-toe-NEE-um) The tissue that lines the abdominal wall and covers most of the organs in the abdomen.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the abdominal cavity, intestine, mesentery, and pelvic organs. It consists of the parietal peritoneum and the visceral peritoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gland in males that surrounds the neck of the BLADDER and the URETHRA. It secretes a substance that liquifies coagulated semen. It is situated in the pelvic cavity behind the lower part of the PUBIC SYMPHYSIS, above the deep layer of the triangular ligament, and rests upon the RECTUM.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The structure of the vertebrate skeleton supporting the lower limbs in humans and the hind limbs or corresponding parts in other vertebrates.

Concepts.definition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

Concepts.definition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organ located between the esophagus and the small intestine where digestion of food occurs before passing to the small intestine.

Concepts.definition: The primary organ of food digestion. It is located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive tube between the stomach and the cecum or beginning of the large intestine; it consists of three portions: duodenum, jejunum, and ileum. SYN intestinum tenue.

Concepts.definition: The section of the intestines between the pylorus and cecum. The small intestine is approximately 20 feet long and consists of the duodenum, the jejunum, and the ileum. Its main function is to absorb nutrients from food as the food is transported to the large intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys those that are aging. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach. (OCC)

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (THIGH-royd) A gland located beneath the voice box (larynx) that produces thyroid hormone. The thyroid helps regulate growth and metabolism.

Concepts.definition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

Concepts.definition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Abdomen/abdominal wall

A non-encapsulated elongated and lobulated organ, extending from the concavity of the duodenum to the spleen; it consists of a head, an elongated body, and a tail. It contains two functional components: an exocrine component that secretes juices into the intestine and an endocrine component that secretes hormones (insulin and glucagon).

Concepts.definition: An organ behind the lower part of the stomach that is the shape of a fish and about the size of a hand. It is a compound gland composed of both exocrine and endocrine tissues. The endocrine pancreas makes insulin so that the body can use glucose (sugar) for energy. The exocrine pancreas makes enzymes that help the body digest food. Spread all over the pancreas are areas called the Islets of Langerhans. The cells in these areas each have a special purpose. The alpha cells make glucagon, which raises the level of glucose in the blood; the beta cells make insulin; the delta cells make somatostatin. There are also PP cells and D1 cells, about which little is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.9 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.

Concepts.definition: A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A recess, cavity, or channel.

Concepts.definition: A recess, cavity, or channel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

Concepts.definition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A series of bones, muscles, tendons, and other tissues reaching from the base of the skull to the tailbone. The vertebral column forms the axis of the skeleton and encloses as well as protects the spinal cord and the fluid surrounding the spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: A series of bones, muscles, tendons, and other tissues reaching from the base of the skull to the tailbone. The vertebral column forms the axis of the skeleton and encloses as well as protects the spinal cord and the fluid surrounding the spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The long, tube-shaped organ in the abdomen that completes the process of digestion. The intestine has two parts, the small intestine and the large intestine.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the gastrointestinal tract between the stomach and the anus. It includes the small intestine and large intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: The striated muscle tissue of the heart enveloped by the epicardium and the endocardium.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The striated muscle tissue of the heart enveloped by the epicardium and the endocardium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of the air-filled spaces within the ethmoid, frontal, maxillary, or sphenoid bones, which communicate with the nasal cavity.

Concepts.definition: Any one of the air-filled spaces within the ethmoid, frontal, maxillary, or sphenoid bones, which communicate with the nasal cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The structure found below the ankle joint required for locomotion.

Concepts.definition: The structure found below the ankle joint.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.

Concepts.definition: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Reassignment of Representation term concept from C37901 (site) to C13717 (anatomic site) as part of structured caDSR harmonization activity 10/10/2006.
ValueDomain.administrativeNotes: 2023.5.24 PVs added per ticket request CADSR0002454. ak
